title: Lucy Boynton shows flare for fashion in green tunic dress at NY event for The Politician
text:
She found Hollywood fame and love after starring in last year's Freddie Mercury biopic Bohemian Rhapsody with Rami Malek.

And on Monday night, Lucy Boynton headlined a special event at 92Y in New York promoting Ryan Murphy's Netflix satire The Politician.

Boynton, 25, showed her flare for fashion by arriving in a sea green tunic dress with white Bishop sleeves and Peter Pan collar.

Flare: Lucy Boynton wore a sea green tunic dress with white Bishop sleeves and Peter Pan collar paired with white tights and silver buckle shoes at NY event for Netflix's The Politician

The British actress added white tights and silver buckle shoes for a page boy look.

Her blonde chin-length bob was styled with a side parting and clipped on one side to stop the hair falling in her eyes.

She completed her look with dramatic eye makeup, rosy blush and glossy lip color.

Pretty: The British actress, 25, wore her blonde chin-length bob with a side parting and clipped on one side. She completed her look with dramatic eye makeup, rosy blush and glossy lip color

Group shot: Boyton was joined on the red carpet Monday night by co-stars, from l-r: Julia Schlaepfer, Theo Germaine, Rahne Jones, Laura Dreyfuss and Ben Platt

Boynton was joined at screening and panel discussion by several of her co-stars including Julia Schlaepfer, Theo Germaine, Rahne Jones, Laura Dreyfuss and Ben Platt.

Platt, 26, stars in the series as a high school student determined to be president of the US one day who must first navigate the political challenges of a high school election.

Not present for Monday's event were high-profile castmembers Gwyneth Paltrow, Dylan McDermott, Zoey Deutch and January Jones.

Netflix recently announced it was commissioning a second season of The Politician, which premiered on the streaming platform on September 27.

Satire: Platt, 26, stars as a high school student determined to be president of the US one day who must first navigate the political challenges of a high school election

Cast: Julia Schlaepfer, left, opted for a white mini dress, while Laura Dreyfuss, center, went for a black coat dress and Theo Germaine, right, paired a gray check suit with a graphic t-shirt

Meanwhile, it was reported last week that Boynton is set to star on the big screen as 1960s folk singer and Mick Jagger's girlfriend Marianne Faithfull.

The actress is also in talks to serve as an executive producer on the project which may go into production next summer, Deadline.com reported Thursday.

Faithfull found fame after being discovered by Rolling Stones manager and record producer Andrew Loog Oldham when she attended a party for the band in 1964.

She was 17 when she recorded the song As Tears Go By, written and composed by Mick Jagger, Keith Richards and Oldham, and it became a hit in the UK when it was released in June 1964. It went on to chart in the Billboard 100 in the US in November that year.

New role: Meanwhile, it was reported last week that Boynton is set to star on the big screen as 1960s folk singer and Mick Jagger's girlfriend Marianne Faithfull

Jagger and Faithfull epitomized the Swinging Sixties scene in London with their partying and drug use.

She is said to have inspired several Rolling Stones songs including Sympathy For The Devil, You Can't Always Get What you Want and Wild Horses.

She and Jagger split in 1970 and from then on, her professional and personal life went into a downward spiral.

She battled addiction, lost custody of her young son, attempted suicide and went on to marry and divorce two more times.

Now 72, she lives in Paris and released her 21st studio album Negative Culpability in late 2018.
